The views, opinions and/or findings contained in this report are those of the author(s) and should not be construed as an official Department of the Army or Navy position, policy or decision unless so designated by other documentation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6d258","text":"OBJECTIVE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eor1q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72f4l","text":"To outline steps for properly storing field-collected leech samples and nucleic acid samples purified from these soil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5v73","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbq72","text":"SUMMARY/SCOPE","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dguj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ad1v","text":"The overarching aim of the REDI-NET is to develop a collaborative laboratory network between domestic and international partnering institutions to address disease surveillance needs in order to effectively detect, predict and contain potentially emergent zoonosis. This SOP provides guidance on storage of leech samples and their purified nucleic acid to preserve their integrity for downstream nucleic acid extraction and/or sequencing library preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg7oi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"414c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7528t","text":"MAINTENANCE OF EQUIPMENT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q1u4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81k6n","text":"Decontaminate a PCR workstation by keeping the UV light on for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":63,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2moos","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eoqte","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"A24C9C601FDC11EE882677F57D1AC721","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
keywords: STORAGE PROCEDURE FOR UNTREATED SAMPLE,STORAGE PROCEDURE FOR TOTAL NUCLEIC ACID

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1s61r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfhkt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c8uik","text":"Cool 96-well microfuge tube racks  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2mk8","text":"NOTES: ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":152},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":189},{"key":2,"length":1,"offset":217}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1nvls","text":"Collected leeches need to be kept on cold chain all the time to prevent death and RNA degradation. Viable leeches can be temporarily stored in water at   before being stored individually in  freezer. Store leeches at   until sample processing.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"length":1,"offset":3},{"key":4,"length":1,"offset":71},{"key":5,"length":1,"offset":307}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7nos3","text":"If   storage is not possible, temporarily store the leech samples in a   freezer and follow leech sample processing SOP (REDI-NET Leech Processing SOP L-2) as soon as possible for total nucleic acid extraction. Subsequently, use a portion of the total nucleic acid and reverse- transcribe RNA into cDNA for   storage. To do this, follow the initial steps of the leech sample testing SOP (REDI-NET Leech Testing SOP L-4) cDNA Synthesis until finishing step 40.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"74fq3","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2mtvi","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"1":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"2":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80.","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"3":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0D5235401FE411EE882677F57D1AC721","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"4":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"1162B4701FE411EE882677F57D1AC721","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"},"5":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"142B98701FE411EE882677F57D1AC721","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"752812C9985A11EEA8050A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77mu8","text":"Using clean forceps, transfer individual leech into the corresponding pre-labeled 2.0 mL microfuge tubes and put it onto the microfuge tube rack   sequentially.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":145,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9nbg9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gi9d","text":"Once the rack is full or all leech samples have been completed, label the rack ID with a unique ID.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25hn0","text":"Close the rack lid tightly, secure with clear Saran wrap and immediately transfer to   or   freezer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":85,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":90,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"51v23","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gll4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"42b7f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"clr65","text":"NOTES:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"20r3k","text":"If -20ºC, total nucleic acid extraction needs to be performed preferably within 3 days.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aodvu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rnnc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8leoj","text":"In the clean PCR workstation, carefully transfer the eluted total nucleic acid to a 96-well PCR microplate, make sure to keep samples in the exact same locations corresponding to the rack where the original ticks were stored.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5me63","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cdkds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"43c32","text":"NOTES: ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"961j4","text":"The following procedure is to properly store total nucleic acid extracted from leech samples (including negative controls) using the KingFisher nucleic acid purification system. The eluted total nucleic acid will be in either 96-well microplate (Flex model) or elution strip (Duo Prime model).","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":43}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5s9km","text":"Total nucleic acid samples need to be kept   all the time to minimize RNA degradation.","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"420A74501FE411EE882677F57D1AC721","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"f3ckc","text":"IMPORTANT: Mark the “A1” position of the 96-well microplate to prevent any mistakes on plate orientation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3eo31","text":"Cover the 96-well PCR microplate with adhesive film to prevent spill over or contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ab7h0","text":"Label the film with a unique plate ID.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b45v0","text":"Update the freezer inventory so that samples can be tracked properly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ah868","text":"Update the freezer inventory so samples can be tracked properly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: L-3 LEECH STORAGE
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ht02","text":"RISKS AND PERSONAL PROTECTION:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s5cs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfo6m","text":"Gloves should be worn all the time when handling samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
